page.title: 01HAYDON BRIDGE, OVERVIEW
page.content: The landscape of Block 03850564 Domesday 1985 has changed little since William Cobbett wrote in Rural Rides,1830,"..these sides of Tyne are very fine: corn-fields, woods, pastures". Grass is the natural product of this land. It still is and the cattle & sheep which dominate are still as "beautiful" & "handsome" as those Cobbett saw. The Railway he watched men building still serves us. Important recent changes include the extension of council housing into the south-eastern square kilometre of the block, & a secondary school was built there in 1962 and extended in 1874 & 84. In the pages which follow we concentrate on landscape, farming, our school and historic stone houses. William I took no evidence from N.E.England so we used the 1851 census & mining records.
